While amiodarone does successfully maintain sinus rhythm, it does come with many side effects to be aware of, including bradycardia, hypotension, pulmonary toxicity, and liver and thyroid dysfunction. Studies have shown similar efficacy of BB and amiodarone [31,34]. A large study called PAPABEAR (Prophylactic Amiodarone for the Prevention of Arrhythmias that Begin Early After Revascularization, Valve Replacement, or Repair) trial showed that the use of oral amiodarone resulted in a large reduction in the incidence of postoperative atrial tachyarrhythmias.
